common_issues.title: Pieces Assistant Vague Responses
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Assistant responding with vague promises of future solutions instead of actionable answers. This occurs after multiple requests within a conversation, especially with large context sizes. Restarting PiecesOS provides a temporary fix, and the issue is linked to specific macOS versions and M3 chip compatibility.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:**  

This issue was automatically created by the "pieces-support-bot" on March 13, 2025. 

**Key Points:**

* User @seantiz created an issue that needs further investigation.
* The issue has been assigned to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* A follow-up is expected within 24 hours.

**Problems Identified:**

* Specific problem description is missing.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* None yet. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Open and awaiting investigation.

**Additional Information:**

* The bot provided links to related issues, documentation, and YouTube channel for user reference.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Running in Basic Mode due to Device Constraints"

**Key points raised:**

* Users @hra42, @joelash, and @bartonfriedland reported encountering "running in basic mode due to device constraints" message while using PiecesOS.
* The issue seemed to affect M3 Macs running macOS 15.3.1.
* The issue prevented the secret message feature from working properly and led to problems with Workstream Activity and LTM updates.
* The "Unknown Origin" element in the telemetry browser raised questions about a potentially older version of PiecesOS causing issues.

**Problems identified:**

* A bug causing the message "running in basic mode due to device constraints" to appear on M3 Macs despite supporting vector search.
* The bug caused issues with specific features like the secret message function, Workstream Activity, and LTM updates.
* Confusion around the meaning of "basic mode" and its limitations.
* Queries about the "Unknown Origin" element and its possible impact.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Restarting PiecesOS was identified as a temporary workaround to resolve the issue.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed a fix for the bug would be included in the next version of PiecesOS.
* Clarification was provided regarding the meaning of "basic mode" and its limitations in terms of vector search support.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The bug causing the "running in basic mode" message and associated problems will be addressed in the next PiecesOS update.
* Users experiencing the issue can currently use the temporary workaround of restarting PiecesOS.
* More information on the "Unknown Origin" element was requested for further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be specific to M3 Macs running macOS 15.3.1.
* More information about the "Unknown Origin" element is needed to determine its impact and resolution.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.0.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When copy paste code sencond time in Ask anything give error  this message is empty please try again
## GitHub Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Users were receiving an empty message error ("this message is empty please try again show error") when attempting to send messages on the desktop app after a recent update.

**Key Points:**

* Multiple users reported the issue across macOS and Windows versions.
* The issue specifically occurred when attempting to send a second message in a new chat.

**Solutions:**

* The Pieces support bot acknowledged the issue and provided resources for troubleshooting and support.
* The Pieces team identified the problem and released a patch to resolve the issue.

**Outcome:**

* The patch successfully addressed the empty message error, and users confirmed the issue was resolved.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is closed and resolved.

common_issues.title: Pieces extension conflicts causing UI/functional errors
common_issues.description: Pieces extensions across different platforms (VS Code, Chrome, Desktop) are causing conflicts resulting in UI glitches like uneditable fields, disappearing cursors, and dysfunctional buttons.  Troubleshooting includes disabling the extension, restarting the application, and checking for updates. The Pieces team actively investigates and resolves these issues with patches and updates.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Cursor Disappears in Pieces Tool Window

**Key Points:**

* User (@hikineet98) reported an issue where the cursor disappears in the Pieces Tool Window after running a script file and removing the edit cursor.
* The issue was replicated by the Pieces team and confirmed by the lead developer (@robert-at-pieces).

**Problems Identified:**

* The cursor disappears unexpectedly, preventing further interaction within the Tool Window.
* The cause of the issue remains unclear, potentially related to a conflict between the Tool Window and the Pieces for Visual Studio plugin.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solutions were proposed or implemented at the time of this summary.
* The lead developer is currently investigating the cause of the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems limited to cases where a script file is run to insert a new row.
* The issue only occurs after the edit cursor is removed from the cell.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* luceat-lux-vestra reported an issue where embed buttons are not working.
* pieces-support-bot acknowledged the issue and assigned it to rutvik-at-pieces.

**Problems identified:**

* Embed buttons not working on specific page.
* Issue previously fixed by blacklisting page.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* rutvik-at-pieces requested PWE version and embed button status to debug the issue.
* luceat-lux-vestra provided the requested information.

**Current status/outcome:**

* rutvik-at-pieces is investigating the issue further.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation took place between March 9th and 13th, 2025.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS updates and installations.  These issues include update failures, inability to choose installation location, and conflicts with antivirus software.  Suggested solutions include checking for existing issues, configuring antivirus settings, and waiting for follow-up from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: 

**Key points raised:**

* The user, laborer123, is experiencing two issues:
    * **Registering a personal domain:** The user is unable to register a previously registered domain on a new PC.
    * **Restoring a backup:** The user wants to back up their current computer using an existing personal domain but is unable to do so.

**Problems identified:**

* The personal domain laborer123 is trying to register is already taken.
* The backup the user wants to use is outdated.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Registering a personal domain:** Mark-at-pieces suggests trying to register a new domain.
* **Restoring a backup:** Mark-at-pieces clarifies that restoring a backup will overwrite all local data and provides instructions on how to initiate the process. 

**Current status/outcome:**

* Laborer123 hasn't responded to Mark-at-pieces' suggestions, leaving the issue unresolved.

**Additional notes:**

* Laborer123 expresses confusion about why they cannot directly back up and create a new personal domain using their existing domain. This suggests a potential misunderstanding of the personal domain functionality. 

**Recommendation:**

Mark-at-pieces could clarify the process of backing up and restoring data using personal domains, addressing laborer123's confusion and potentially resolving the issue.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Author:** pieces-support-bot
**Date:** March 13, 2025
**Topic:** User experiencing an issue with their Pieces OS update.

**Key points raised:**

- User bpluly is experiencing an issue with their Pieces OS update.
- The bot has automatically triaged and routed the issue to the proper Pieces team member.
- Expect a follow-up within 24 hours.
- Suggested related issues and helpful resources are provided.

**Problems identified:**

- User's Pieces OS update failed.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- The issue has been automatically routed to the proper Pieces team member for investigation.

**Current status/outcome:**

- User can expect a follow-up from the Pieces team within 24 hours. 
- No immediate solution is provided in the conversation.

**Additional notes:**

- The bot provided related issues and helpful resources for the user. 
- It's unclear whether the provided resources and existing issues offer immediate solutions for the user's specific problem.
- It's recommended to keep track of the issue and wait for the Pieces team's follow-up for further resolution.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** PiecesOS unable to launch on Windows due to App Installer error.

**Key Points:**

* User reported error message when launching PiecesOS.
* Issue likely caused by bug in Windows App Installer.
* Some users reported their antivirus software (Kaspersky) blocking PiecesOS.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Update Microsoft Store App Installer.
* Configure antivirus software to allow PiecesOS processes.

**Current Status:**

* Issue remains unresolved for some users.
* Further investigation needed to determine root cause and permanent solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* User @bejokun provided a screenshot of their error message.
* Pieces support team recommended checking existing issues and documentation for further assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS installation ignoring default system app locations and update failures. Some encounter conflicts with antivirus software like Kaspersky, flagging it as a virus. Proposed solutions include configuring antivirus exceptions and ensuring the system app installer is updated. Pieces team is investigating the issues.

related_issues.title: Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
related_issues.text:
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS_11.2.2.0_x64

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/160ed12d-f0a1-46be-bf36-05502353405e)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @uwascan reported an issue.
* The issue has been classified and routed to the relevant Pieces team member.
* A follow-up is expected within 24 hours.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific issue faced by @uwascan is not mentioned.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bot suggested three related issues that might be helpful.
* The bot provided links to resources that may help the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been acknowledged and routed.
* A follow-up from the Pieces team is pending.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation occurred on March 12, 2025.
* The conversation was initiated by the Pieces-support-bot.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving extension conflicts:** The high frequency of issues related to Pieces extensions causing UI/functional errors across platforms needs immediate attention. Focus on improving compatibility and communication between extensions to provide a seamless user experience.

**Address Pieces Assistant's vague responses:** Investigate and resolve the issue of Pieces Assistant providing vague responses, especially with large context sizes. Improve its ability to provide actionable answers and clear solutions.

**Improve Pieces OS update and installation process:** Address issues related to update failures, installation location conflicts, and antivirus software compatibility. Provide clear instructions and solutions for users experiencing these problems.

**Investigate Kaspersky antivirus conflicts:**  The issue with Kaspersky flagging Pieces OS as a virus needs immediate attention. Collaborate with Kaspersky to whitelist Pieces OS and prevent false positives.
**Improve communication on personal domain functionality:** Address user confusion regarding personal domain backup and restoration. Provide clearer documentation and in-app guidance on this feature.
